Posts.Title: Stage IV: ER+ PR- Her 2 -, a lot of Bone Mets- any others? WanderingSpirit WanderingSpirit

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2014 07:35AM CAROL1MAINE wrote: Hi WAndering Spirit  almost 4 years ago I was feeling just like you are now. I was stage 4  ILC right from the start with extensive bone mets in every bone they said they looked like swiss cheese. Also soft tissue involvement in abdomen. I am doing great TM down to 31 . numbness and tingling nerve pain down arms and legs all gone tailbone does not hurt anymore. as the anti normals work on shrinking the lesions and inflammation my symptoms improved greatly. Was on Arimedex worked wonders. A bit of advice the generic gave me SE of joint pain stiffness OC switched me to the brand Arimedex it was so much Easier to take. Also been on Zometa now Xgeva .I think back on those 4years and realize I did spend some days worrying about CT test etc when in retrospect I wasted days I should have enjoyed. I find my self in a much more peaceful place now and I hope you can also with time get there too. Good luck. thinking of you Hope this helps  PM me anytime Carol
Posts.Title: Stage IV: ER+ PR- Her 2 -, a lot of Bone Mets- any others? WanderingSpirit WanderingSpirit

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2015 09:02AM CAROL1MAINE wrote: Yes i also got lepto diagnosis with same outcome back in sept 2014. Onc put me on temador oral brain cancer drug which crosses the blood brain barrier and thought to slow down lepto. I understand how scary this is I went thru all sorts of emotions but now I can enfoy my days . Best wishes. I am HER- so herceptin was not an option for me.

ONC has never ordered a PET she sais it really isn't helpful with ILC. So like you I winder how tell if healed. Also I.m having Fermer pain on outsde but since there is large tumor just holes where do they radiate? My ONC says all my bones look like swiss cheese. But it's been 3 years doing good. Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Bone mets...I don't get it. raro DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 10:47AM - edited Jan 6, 2011 10:49AM by CAROL1MAINE sure hope your tumor markers come down. I started Faslodex 6 months ago as soon as I was diagnosed, Onc was thrilled with my response, TM's went from 279 down to 60 and new CT last month also showed great decreases. I have no side effects except some head pain from bone mets for a few days but thats ok just means its working on the tumors and they don't like it!! Glad you asked about Faslodex the responses you got also helped me I.ve been wondering how much longer this will work for me, the tumor markers are going down more slowly only 7 points last month. Is this to be expected? Thanks I'm new to this site but am so glad I found it.

Posts.Content: CAROL1MAINE wrote: I,m going to ONC tomorrow. I plan on asking for more details on scan results from April. CT scans showed stable, bone scans confusing since not picking up much even though I have mets to entire spine, collar bone, head and skull and pelvis and entire skeleton system. Radiologist thinks it is evenly dispersed in the bones so soaks it up all over so no one area picks it up more than others? I was diagnosed last June 2010 with stage IV bone mets and abdominal area mass. TM 279, October scans showed recression  areas. TM last 3 months were 42, 40, 40. I was put on Faslodex and Zometa right from the start. should I settled for this or would a new treatment plan like Femera help with more recression? I,ve been on this site for months and thank you all have learned so much. I'd like to be more of an advocate and be more agressive, Onc feels TM of 38 are fine and says I'm almost there.Since I,ve been on Faslodex for almost a year I'm afraid It's going to stop working. I have my TM tomorrow if they go up, even a little, then I'll need to change?  From what I have read some ONC are more accresive? Thanks I never know the right questions to askthe ONC so she'll tell me more. She just says i,ve had this cancer  ILC  a lnog time before we found it and it should take a long time to go back up? Can anyone help explain all this to me? I am thankful I feel pretty good and willhave my first cancerversary next month! Posts.Title: Why am I having trouble walking? (bone mets issue) Cynthia1962 Cynthia1962

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 06:59PM CAROL1MAINE wrote: yes I've had neck upper back pain. Been on Faslodex for a year now and have had different muscle pains, First one was on the side of me knee, hurt to walk on but only lasted 2 days, then next month my left arm bicept hurt to bend up my arm strange but also only lasted 2 to 3 days, then I started to get a stiff neck and even some pain over my ear up the side of my head which almost felt like it could be coming from the back of my neck but again it is going away, but honestly Faslodex has been the right drug for me according the my Onc. TM went from 279 down to 33 and scans at 4 months showed regression my last ones in April where stable, My 1st cancerversary is this week not sure how long Faslodex will keep working, any ladies out therebeen on Faslodex for more than a year?
